thread.title: 'Rocky Horror Picture Show,' Rock and Roll Freak Show: 15 things to do this weekend in CNY
thread.title_full: 'Rocky Horror Picture Show,' Rock and Roll Freak Show: 15 things to do this weekend in CNY

author: Katrina Tulloch | ktulloch@syracuse.com
title: 'Rocky Horror Picture Show,' Rock and Roll Freak Show: 15 things to do this weekend in CNY
text:
SYRACUSE, N.Y. -- With so many zombie-related parties on Saturday, you'd think this weekend was Halloween. Central New York, get your costumes together, carve your pumpkins and let's do the "Time Warp" again. 
Note: Enchanted Beaver Lake does take place this weekend, but it is sold out. Rock band Chicago performs at the Landmark Theatre in Syracuse on Wednesday, Oct. 21. David M.Earnisse Photography Boo 
1. Chicago at the Landmark Chicago , the legendary American rock band (with horns), brings its Heart and Soul 2015 tour to the Landmark Theatre on Oct. 21. Heralded as one of the most successful rock groups in the U.S., Chicago sold more than 100 million records since forming in 1967. Despite long-running commercial success, chart-topping hits and iconic status, the band has been snubbed by the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame year after year. Where: Landmark Theatre at 362 S. Salina St. When: Wednesday, Oct. 21 at 7:30 p.m. How much: Ticket prices range from $55-76, fees included. 
2. Women on the Money The Gage Center will present "Women on the Money," a unique look at women's history through the lens of eight ancient currencies. While the idea of a woman on modern U.S. currency has been met with controversy , ancient societies granted this honor to a host of fascinating women. From Cleopatra to lesser known wives of emperors, each influential woman remains an enduring symbol of her society. Where: Matilda Joslyn Gage Center at 210 E. Genesee St, Fayetteville. When: Thursday, Oct. 22 from 7 to 9 p.m. How much: Tickets are $10 or $8 for students with ID. Ephraim LaGrow, 1, of Chittenango plays peek-a-boo while pumpkin picking at Critz Farms in Cazenovia, N.Y., Saturday Sept. 26, 2015. Photo by Scott Schild. 
3. Critz Farms Fall Harvest Celebration The Rosamond Gifford Zoo and Friends of the Zoo teamed up with Cazenovia's Critz Farms this fall for the farm's annual Fall Harvest Celebration , which continues until Oct. 25. The theme for the corn maze this year is the "Giant Zoo-Tastic Octopus's Garden." Critz Farms designed the maze in honor of the zoo's giant Pacific octopus exhibit. There will be apple and pumpkin picking, wagon rides, live music, cider-making demonstrations, an animal area, a cow train and a tasting room. Where: Critz Farms at 3232 Rippleton Rd. (Route 13) in Cazenovia. When: Weekly through Oct. 25. Hours Monday through Friday are 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. On Saturday and Sunday, hours are 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. How much: Admission is $7.50 per person on weekend days, with a $30 per car maximum (No family riding together in one car pays more than $30). Kids younger than 2 are free, and seniors are $5. 
4. Wild Adriatic Upstate New York rockers Wild Adriatic return often to CNY, having played at the Westcott Theater and the former Bull & Bear Pub in the last couple of years. Relix Magazine calls them "flawlessly tight with infectious melodies & tons of soul." Where: Funk 'N' Waffles Armory Square at 313 S. Clinton St. When: Friday, Oct. 23 from 8 p.m. to 1:30 a.m. How much: Tickets are $7 online and $10 at the door. 
5. Rock and Roll Freak Show The Landmark Theatre will host a medley of Syracuse bands at the 2015 Rock and Roll Freak Show, including Pale Green Stars, Hobo Graffiti, Amerikan Primitive, Spring Street Family Band and The Stacey White Suite. There will also be makeup artists, vendors, drink specials, a costume contest, prizes and haunted tours of the theater on Friday, Oct. 23 and Saturday, Oct. 24. Where: Landmark Theatre at 362 S. Salina St. When: Friday, Oct. 23 at 8 p.m. How much: Admission is $10. 
6. 'Friday the 13th' film festival The Palace Theater will host a Halloween film festival with multiple "Friday the 13th" screenings, plus a feature showing of "Hack-O-Lantern." All films will be shown on 35 mm prints. There will be vendors, special guests and alcohol for guests 21 and older. All films are rated R. 
5:30 p.m. - Camp Crystal Lake Haunted Walk (theater lobby) 6 p.m. - One Last Shot (Upstate N.Y. Punk Rock Band) 6:30 p.m. - Hack-O-Lantern 8:15 p.m. - Friday the 13th PT 4: The Final Chapter 9:45 p.m. - One Last Shot 10 p.m. - Friday the 13th Pt 5: A New Beginning 11:45 p.m. - Friday the 13th Pt 6: Jason Lives Where: Palace Theater at 2384 James St. When: Friday, Oct. 23. Doors open at 5:30 p.m. How much: $20 at the door and $15 in advance. Bring a can of food for admission to The Haunted Walk. Advance sale tickets avail at Modern Pop Culture in Armory Square) and online . Marishka Biela poses for a picture at Zoo Boo at the Rosamond Gifford Zoo in Syracuse, N.Y., Saturday, Oct. 19, 2013. Kevin Rivoli | krivoli@syracuse.com 
7. Zoo Boo Rosamond Gifford Zoo will celebrate Halloween with the annual Zoo Boo series. Kids and parents can wear Halloween costumes to the zoo, and see the entire animal collection. Activities include trick-or-treat stations, creepy crawly encounters, games, tattoos, a mega raffle, an inflatable activity center and professional face painting for $3 per child. Where: Rosamond Gifford Zoo at 1 Conservation Place. When: Saturday and Sunday, Oct. 24 and 25 from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Zoo Boo is held rain or shine. How much: $8 per child plus the cost of zoo admission. Advance sale tickets are available for zoo members only. Buy tickets on rosamondgiffordzoo.org/zoo-boo . 
8. 'The Rocky Horror Picture Show' Filming of "The Rocky Horror Picture Show" movie began in October 1974, but the movie officially hit U.S. theaters in August 1975, making this fall the 40th anniversary of the film's release. See the cult classic on the big screen at the Palace Theater, where there will be a Halloween costume contest and cash bar. Where: Palace Theater at 2384 James St. When: Saturday, Oct. 24. Doors open at 6 p.m. There will be a "Killer Klowns from Outer Space" screening at 8:30 p.m. and then "Rocky Horror" screens at 11:30 p.m. How much: Tickets are $15 in advance or $20 at the door. 
Related: Read our 'Rocky Horror Picture Show' virgin's guide 
9. Lighting of the Vines at Owera Vineyards Owera Vineyards will host its second annual "Lighting of the Vines" Dinner on Saturday, with Owera head chef Robert Potter's special selection of fine hors d'oeuvres, amuse-bouche, three courses, and decadent dessert, paired with Owera wines. Live music will be performed by The DeSantis Swing Band. This year's theme will be "The Great Gatsby." Gatsby-themed and 1920's style attire is encouraged. Where: Owera Vineyards at 5276 E. Lake Rd., Cazenovia. When: Saturday, Oct. 24 at 6 to 9:30 p.m. How much: Tickets are available for $125 per person or $200 per couple by contacting events@oweravineyards.com . 
10. 95X Zombie Crawl 2015 The annual 95X Zombie Crawl in downtown Syracuse kicks off at J Ryan's Pub at 5 p.m. Makeup artists will be on hand to "zombify" guests. See the full schedule with stops at Clark's Ale House, Clinton St. Pub and King of Clubs. The finale party is at Syracuse Suds Factory starts at 10 p.m. with live music. Where: Armory Square bars. When: Saturday, Oct. 24 at 5 p.m. How much: $5 to die, $10 to get bitten, $20 to rot. 
11. Wicked Woods Wicked Woods at Green Lakes State Park will have Halloween fun for all ages: Halloween Headquarters with crafts from 4 to 8 p.m., face painting from 4 to 7 p.m., a Trick-or-Treat Trail on the beach from 4 to 6 p.m. (costumes encouraged), a Haunted Trail from 6:30 to 7:30 p.m. (for braver participants) and a bonfire on the beach at 7 p.m. For more information, call 315-637-5188. Where: Green Lakes State Park at 7900 Green Lakes Rd., Fayetteville. When: Saturday, Oct. 24 from 4 to 8 p.m. How much: Free and open to the public. Comedy Central stars Abbi Jacobson and Ilana Glazer of "Broad City" will speak at Syracuse University's Homecoming Weekend. Provided photo 
12. 'Broad City' stars speak at SU Homecoming Syracuse University will bring two Comedy Central stars to campus this weekend for Homecoming. Abbi Jacobson and Ilana Glazer , the co-creators and stars of "Broad City," will visit for a moderated conversation on Saturday. Now entering its third season, "Broad City" was nominated for a 2015 Critic's Choice Award for Best Comedy Series. Where: Goldstein Auditorium at Syracuse University. When: Saturday, Oct. 24 at 8 p.m. How much: Tickets for this show are $5 for SU/ESF students, faculty and staff and are available for purchase at Schine Box Office now. Valid college ID is required. For returning alumni who wish to attend, tickets will be available online at boxoffice.syr.edu for $15. 
13. Murder mystery dinner Come to the Aurora Inn, Rowland House for a three-course dinner and participate in a murder mystery. Your character, story line and costume props are provided, while the rest is up to you. Throughout dinner, investigate clues of the murder and solve the mystery with the help of Dale, your innkeeper and host for the evening. The dinner is for guests 21 and older. Where: Rowland House at 453 Main St., Aurora. When: Saturday, Oct. 24 from 6 to 11 p.m. Check-in at 3 p.m. How much: Packages are $475 per couple, with a wine and cheese reception hour, a three-course paired dinner and overnight accommodations. Party goers share a moment together in the dance hall at the K-Rock Zombie Ball, held at the Landmark Theatre. Ryan MacCammon 
14. KROCK Zombie Ball 2015 There will be costume contests, have your photo taken on the "blood carpet", psychics, palm readers, live DJ's and a zombie movie on the big screen. Come dressed as one of the undead or have a makeup artist transform you into a brain-eating zombie. Where: Landmark Theatre at 362 S. Salina St. When: Saturday, Oct. 24. Doors open at 8 p.m., party at 9 p.m. and movie at 10 p.m. How much: Tickets are $10 in advance at the Landmark Theatre Box Office, by phone, or online at Ticketmaster.com 
15. CNY Wedding World Expo Brides planning for their wedding days can find all the help they need at the Wedding World Expo at the New York State Fairgrounds. Exhibitors covering all aspects of a wedding, reception and honeymoon will be on hand for what organizers call the largest bridal show in Central New York. There will be free massages available, horse and carriage rides, a hair/makeup show and a runway fashion show. Where: NYS Fairgrounds at 581 State Fair Blvd. When: Sunday, Oct. 25 from 11 a.m. - 4 p.m. How much: Admission is free, but brides must pre-register online . Free parking. 
Katrina Tulloch writes features and entertainment stories for Syracuse.com and The Post-Standard. Contact her: Email | Twitter | Google+
